intro: Vernonia cleocalderonae, commonly known as the Cleocalderon Vernonia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is known for its yellow to orange flowers. It has lance-shaped leaves and is often found in arid regions of southern Mexico. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
